definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: In China during anti-Japan riots, yes.
sentences.chinese: 中國的反日遊行，算是吧。

sentences.english: The Syrian government is continuing its crackdown Monday against anti-government protesters.
sentences.chinese: 敘利亞政府正在繼續鎮壓反日反政府示威者。

sentences.english: Anti-Japan behaviour at the Olympics would be a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 奧運期間的反日活動也將是一場災難。

sentences.english: He criticised Beijing's handling of the anti-Japan protests.
sentences.chinese: 他批評中國政府對反日示威的處理手法。

sentences.english: Then we started to do military training at an anti-communism and anti-Japanese university.
sentences.chinese: 然後我們在反共反日大學開始進行軍事訓練。

definition: to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
to invade China (referring to 19th century imperialist powers and Japan)
the Save the Nation Anti-Japanese Protest Movement stemming from the Manchurian railway incident of 18th July 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变
pinyin: Kang4 Ri4 Jiu4 wang2 Yun4 dong4
